name: Serbia
takeaway: The main channels of communication and cooperation between Serbia and the PRC are government and ruling party elites. Many other instruments of PRC influence are ostensibly neglected, as most issues of importance can be handled this way.
Serbian public opinion has particularly positive views of China, not least due to government promotion of positive images. Therefore, no major propaganda or coercion means are needed.
Economy remains the crucial field of bilateral relations, with trends of growth in academic and defense cooperation.
description-1: In 2023, Serbia had a GDP per capita of US$11,361 and a total population of 6.79 million people.
description-2: Serbia established diplomatic relations with the People’s Republic of China in 1955. Serbia was ranked 98th in Reporters Without Borders 2024 World Press Freedom Index, and rated Partly Free in Freedom House‘s 2024 Global Freedom Index, with a score of 57/100.

Media.evidence: There is no observation of the indicator phenomenon.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: There is only one Serbian media outlet affiliated with Belt and Road Media Community. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Few" rating. This outlet is the highly influential public broadcaster, Radio-Television of Serbia. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Significant" rating.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: In the past, particularly between 2011 and 2018, there have been several instances of prominent paid visits of Serbian journalists to China. Also, Chinese journalists have regular visits to Serbia. However, within the time frame of the project, there were no publicly recorded occasions of paid visits, though it seems highly likely that the previous practice had not bee discontinued. Therefore, while the local experts have observed the Indicator phenomena, they cannot provide the necessary documentary evidence to answer the Indicator in the affirmative.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: There is no observation of the indicator phenomenon.
Media.note: Within the time frame of the project, there were no publicly recorded instances of PRC-organized training of Serbian journalists, media organizations or online influencers.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: China Radio International has been present in Serbia for decades, and excluding globally available cable channel CGTN, it is the only PRC state outlet. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Few" rating. Apart from radio broadcasting, CRI is active via its online portal and Facebook page, as well as through arrangements with the weekly "Nedeljnik" and Radio-Television of Serbia. However, its content does not attract a large audience and is not particularly influent. Therefore, this Indicator deserves an "Insignificant" rating.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: There is no observation of the indicator phenomenon.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: There are three outlets (WTF Radio, Nedeljnik, RTS) offering content provided by China Radio International. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Few" rating. Total reach and audience of these programs remains very limited, and they are presented irregularly. Therefore, this Indicator deserves an "Insignificant" rating.
Media.note: While China Radio International is technically broadcasted through a local station’s frequency and China Today supplement is handed out once a month with a weekly newsmagazine Nedeljnik, their reach in Serbian media landscape is limited. Chinese TV networks, such as CGTN, which are available via cable, are not part of domestic media landscape per se, and also have very limited reach.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: There is no observation of the indicator phenomenon.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: There is no observation of the indicator phenomenon.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: Printed and online media with the largest readerships, as well as TV channels with the largest viewership, including the public broadcasting service, regularly promote the idea of Serbian-Chinese relations as "steel friendship". Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "More than a few" rating. These media reach by far the biggest share of Serbian population. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Significant" rating.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: There is no observation of the indicator phenomenon.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: Serbia and China maintain close inter-parliamentary cooperation, including a friendship group in the Parliament of Serbia. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "Yes" response.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: For over a decade, Serbia has been receiving numerous in-kind donations from the PRC. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "More than a few" rating. These donations have made significant impact across various sectors of Serbian society and economy. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Significant" rating.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: There are many recorded contacts of Serbian and Chinese diplomats and members of political elites, almost none of which are for training purposes. Thus, this indicator deserves a "Few" rating. The only training recorded in 2023 was a seminar by China International Development Cooperation agency for lower-level party and parliament members from Serbia. Therefore, this indicator deserves an "insignificant" rating.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: There is no observation of the indicator phenomenon.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: There is no observation of the indicator phenomenon.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: Strategic partnership relations between the Republic of Serbia and the People's Republic of China were established in 2009, further deepened during 2013, and then raised to the level of a comprehensive strategic partnership in June 2016. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Yes" response.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: In Serbian political vocabulary, this issue is referred to as "one China policy", but its contents entirely correspond to PRC's "one China principle". Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Yes" response.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: No evidence can be found of the Index country taking a definitive position regarding this Indicator. Therefore, the Index country has remained silent regarding the PRC’s territorial claim and the Indicator warrants a 2 score.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: In 2016, Serbia reportedly supported a declaration designating China's Xinjiang policies as fight against terrorism and extremism. It has also repeatedly endorsed Chinese positions on Xinijang. Therefore, Serbia has voiced support for the PRC’s treatment of its Uyghur population and the Indicator warrants a 4 score.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: High-level Serbian officials have repeately expressed support to Chinese positions on Tibet. Therefore, Serbia has voiced support for the PRC’s treatment of its Tibet population and the Indicator warrants a 4 score.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: The current president of Serbia expressed explicit support to Xi Jinping over Hong Kong National Sercurity Law in 2020. Therefore, Serbia has voiced support for the PRC’s imposition of the National Security Law on Hong Kong and the Indicator warrants a 4 score.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.evidence: There are several legitimate Universities in Serbia, small number of them engaging in research partnerships with PRC-connected entities. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Few" rating. These are prominent public universities, often cooperating with Huawei, itself an influential regional and global actor. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Significant" rating.
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.evidence: There are several legitimate Universities in Serbia, only two of which (Belgrade and Novi Sad) have Confucius Institutes. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Few" rating. These are two biggest and most influential universities in Serbia. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Significant" rating.
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.evidence: Chinese language is studied in several dozen primary and high schools, with plans to increase the number of schools. Some of the teachers were reportedly recruited by the Chinese Ministry of Education. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Yes" response.
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.evidence: The Institute for International Politics and Economics, a Belgrade-based public academic research center, is part of other cooperation networks, such as the Silk Road NGO Cooperation Network and China-CEEC Think Tanks Network. ﻿Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Few" rating. The IIPE is the oldest and most influential public research institution in Serbian political science, with close ties to the government and significant media visibility. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "significant" rating.
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.evidence: There are several legitimate Universities in Serbia, a number of them receiving financial and other benefits from PRC-connected entities. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Few" rating. These are prominent public universities and research institutions, and their number appears to be growing. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Significant" rating.
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.evidence: There is no publicly available information on cooperation within talents or scholars programs, except for one instance involving the Faculty of Engineering - University of Belgrade, from 2016. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Few" rating. Recorded participation produced no major consequences in academic, political or economic domain in Serbia. Therefore, this Indicator deserves an "Insignificant" rating.
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.evidence: There is no observation of the indicator phenomenon.
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.evidence: There is no observation of the indicator phenomenon.
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.evidence: There is no observation of the indicator phenomenon.
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.evidence: PRC-connected entities like the Confucious Institutes or PRC Ministry of Education participate in providing funding and staff for Chinese language classes. However, there have been no indications of PRC-related entities taking part in designing curriculums apart from language classes.
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.evidence: Only a small number of academics in Serbia are dealing with issues connected with China. Even less of them cover the human rights level in the PRC, some by denying the abuses. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Few" rating. Academics and their works or public appearances are not widely followed in Serbia. Therefore, this Indicator deserves an "Insignificant" rating.
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Domestic Politics.evidence: Numerous Serbian cities, including the capital, as well as an autonomous province, have been signing commercial and other agreements with the PRC government or state-owned enterprises. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "More than a few" rating. The projects thus agreed comprise a large portion of the country's population and economic activity. Thus, this indicator reserves a "Significant" rating.
Domestic Politics.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Domestic Politics.evidence: Numerous municipalities in Serbia have sister-city ties with municipalities in China, while Vojvodina autonomous province has agreements on cooperation with several Chinese provinces. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "More than a few" rating. These municipalities account for a majority of the Serbian population and most of the GDP. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Significant" rating.
Domestic Politics.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Domestic Politics.evidence: There is no observation of the indicator phenomenon.
Domestic Politics.note: There is no information on such visits in the public domain. There are a lot of high profile mutual visits, but they are organized as official state trips, with all of the accompanying logistics and protocols. In this light, there do not seem to be many reasons for additional and more inappropriate visits – all the lobbying and policy coordination can be done on occasions of official trips.
Domestic Politics.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Domestic Politics.evidence: Mayors of two major cities in Serbia visited China over the last several years. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "Few" rating. Within the time frame, the number and scope of visits was smaller than before, and the Belgrade mayor has not visited China in 2022 and 2023. Therefore, this Indicator deserves an "Insignificant" rating.
Domestic Politics.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Domestic Politics.evidence: Members of the Serbian ruling and dominant party have regular official visits to the CCP. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "More than a few" rating. These visits are complementary to deepening bilateral ties between the two administrations. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Significant" rating.
Domestic Politics.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Domestic Politics.evidence: There has been no publicly disclosed information about government officials receiving campaign donations that originate in the PRC, and only one instance of an opposition member receiving funds. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Few" rating. The opposition party leader in question has a very modest influence in Serbian politics. Therefore, this Indicator deserves an "Insignificant" rating.
Domestic Politics.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Domestic Politics.evidence: There is no observation of the indicator phenomenon.
Domestic Politics.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Domestic Politics.evidence: There is no observation of the indicator phenomenon.
Domestic Politics.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Domestic Politics.evidence: Few officials in charge of handling relations with China will occasionally echo PRC talking points. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Few" rating. These are usually high level party and government officials. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Significant" rating.
Domestic Politics.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Domestic Politics.evidence: A small number of former Serbian officials are offered and accept appointments in PRC-invested companies. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Few" rating. The officials are well-connected individuals, formerly obtaining top level positions in the government, Central Bank or the Chamber of Commerce. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Significant" rating.
Domestic Politics.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Domestic Politics.evidence: There is no observation of the indicator phenomenon.
Domestic Politics.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Economy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Economy.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon.
Economy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Economy.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon.
Economy.note: China is the top customer for Serbian timber, relatively biggest buyer of Serbian copper and moderately big importer of Serbian steel. The data for 2022 show decrease in these sectors compared to 2021. This is to be monitored as further increase of copper and steel exports by Serbia-based Chinese-owned companies to China is expected in the near future.
Economy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Economy.evidence: Chinese Huawei has been in charge of the City Data Center in Kragujevac, fourth biggest city in Serbia, since 2020. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Yes" response.
Economy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Economy.evidence: Serbia officially joined AIIB in August 2019, after its membership was approved by the AIIB Board of Governors in December 2018. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Yes" response.
Economy.answerer: Answered by , and has been reviewed by

Economy.evidence: Serbian Chamber of Commerce is listed as a member on the official web page of Silk Road Chamber of International Commerce. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Yes" response.
Economy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Economy.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon.
Economy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Economy.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon.
Economy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Economy.evidence: The free trade agreement between Serbia and China was signed on October 17, 2023. It was ratified in the Parliament of Serbia on October 26, 2023. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "Yes" response.
Economy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Economy.evidence: At least two laws, from 2019 and 2020, have reportedly been adopted with the purpose of facilitating PRC-related entities' projects in Serbia. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Yes" response.
Economy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Economy.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon.
Economy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Technology.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon.
Technology.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Technology.evidence: In Serbia, one major telecom (former Telenor, currently: Yettel) has signed agreements on 5G network infrastructure with Huawei.  Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Few" rating. This telecom is among the largest in the country, but the project in question has been in the experimental phase for years. Therefore, this Indicator deserves an "Insignificant" rating.
Technology.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Technology.evidence: In Serbia, one major telecom (publicly owned Telekom Serbia) has signed agreements on fiber optic/broadband network infrastructure with Huawei. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Few" rating. This telecom acounts for the  majority of users in the country. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Significant" rating.
Technology.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Technology.evidence: In 2020, Huawei opened an Innovations and Development Centre in Belgrade. It was a high-profile event in the presence of the Prime Minister of Serbia and Chinese ambassador to Belgrade. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Yes" response.
Technology.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Technology.evidence: Facial recognition technology provided by PRC-connected entities is operational only in the capital city, Belgrade. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Few" rating. Belgrade is the most important economic and political hub in the country, and by far the largest city. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Significant".
Technology.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Technology.evidence: Serbian participation in "smart city" cooperation with PRC was a provision in the 2019 agreement on joining the Belt and Road Initiative. By 2023, it has begun only in Belgrade. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Few" rating. Belgrade is the most important economic and political hub in the country, and by far the largest city. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Significant" rating.
Technology.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Technology.evidence: Publicly owned Telekom Serbia has conducted a 150 million EUR project of fibre optic cable installation together with Huawei, serving tens of thousands of households. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Yes"response.
Technology.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Technology.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon.
Technology.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Technology.evidence: ComTrade, an IT company with government connections, announced software cooperation and signed an agreement with BeiDou in 2017. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Few" rating. No progress in cooperation has been reported since. Thererfore, this Indicator  deserves an "Insignificant" rating.
Technology.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Technology.evidence: In the summer of 2020, Serbia and China signed a MoU on ooperation in the field of innovation in the research and use of space for peaceful purposes. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Yes" response.
Technology.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Technology.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon.
Technology.note: Central and local governments were not involved in such collaboration, but a major IT company with government ties signed an agreement on cooperation on BeiDou in 2017. No progress on the issue was recorded since.
Technology.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Society.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon.

Society.evidence: In earlier years, there were scarce indications or proof of representative trade unions cooperation with the ACFTU. Recently, there have been no new developments and reports of earlier cooperation have been removed from the public domain. Therefore, a definite answer to this Indicator cannot be provided.
Society.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Society.evidence: The ambassador of the PRC traditionally organizes celebrations of the Lunar New Year. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Few" rating. These events are attended by top-ranked Serbian officials. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Significant" rating.
Society.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Society.evidence: One of two major journalists' associations is closely engaged with its Chinese counterpart. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Few" rating. The journalists association in question is the more influential one, connected with the government structures, while the writer's association is nationally representative.  Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Significant" rating.
Society.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Society.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon.
Society.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Society.evidence: There is a small number of Serbian media covering China-specific topics, and even less of them broadcast entertainment content. OTT streaming platforms hosting PRC media channels are not distributed. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Few" rating. Serbian public braodcaster plays PRC-produced and provided content on its less popular channels, with limited viewership. Therefore, this Indicator deserves an "Insignificant" rating.
Society.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Society.evidence: TikTok is a top 5 company in Top Grossing and Free Downloads categories. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Yes" response.
Society.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Society.evidence: Cultural exchange is still a developing segment of Serbian-Chinese cooperation and there are not many publicly funded projects in this regard. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Few" rating. Growing importance of culture in bilateral relations is recorded and prominent institutions are involved on both sides. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Significant" rating.
Society.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Society.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon.
Society.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Society.evidence: In numerous opinion polls, conducted on a yearly basis or more often, Serbian citizens keep expressing largely positive views of China, not least due to public promotion of the two countries' governments' close relations. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Yes" response.
Society.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Military.evidence: Since 2019, Serbia has been procuring military equipment, most notably drones and air defence systems from China. Some of the equipment has already been delivered, while new contracts are pending. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Yes" response.
Military.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Military.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon.
Military.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Military.evidence: As of early 2023, the Pegasus unmanned aerial vehicle, produced through Serbian-Chinese military-technical cooperation, has been introduced as part of the equipment used by the Army of Serbia. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Yes" response.
Military.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Military.evidence: Serbian and Chinese armed forces have been participating in mutual training and education activities for over a decade. They are mostly tied to NBC protection and cyber security. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Yes" response.

Military.evidence: Serbian Chief of Staff and Defense Minister have met with high-ranking PLA officers in 2023. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Yes" response.

Military.evidence: Neither sources, nor publicy available data could provide clear indications on the Indicator phenomenon, although there is general possibility that lucrative appointments have been made. Therefore, a definite answer to this Indicator cannot be provided.

Military.evidence: Serbian Chief of Staff and the now former Director of the Security-Information Agency have called for deepening cooperation with PRC in 2022 and 2023. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Yes" response.
Military.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Military.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon.
Military.note: First joint military exercise was scheduled for 2020 and postponed due to Covid-19 pandemic. In the meantime, at the beginning of the Russian invasion of Ukraine, the Serbian government introduced a moratorium on international military exercises. Despite widening and deepening of Sino-Serbian defence cooperation, exercise plans are still on hold.
Military.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.
